docs.snippet: The social network said it wanted to prevent misleading or deceptive promotional practices.

headline.print_headline: Facebook, Citing Deception,  Bans Cryptocurrency Ads
headline.main: Facebook Bans Ads for Bitcoin and Other Cryptocurrencies

docs.snippet: As Robert S. Mueller’s investigation rolls on, calls for Facebook to provide more information could grow louder.

headline.print_headline: Questions for Facebook About Russia’s Use of Its Network
headline.main: Questions for Facebook About Russia’s Use of Its Network

docs.snippet: Some Facebook executives still seem more interested in defending themselves from criticism than owning their mistakes related to the 2016 election.

headline.print_headline: On Russian Meddling, Some Facebook Leaders Are in Denial
headline.main: On Russia, Facebook Sends a Message It Wishes It Hadn’t

docs.snippet: Rob Goldman, Facebook vice president for ads, tweeted about Russia’s disinformation effort. President Trump then cited him. We fact-checked Mr. Goldman.

headline.print_headline: How Do a Facebook Executive’s Tweets on Russia Match Up With the Facts?
headline.main: Fact-Checking a Facebook Executive’s Comments on Russian Interference

docs.snippet: Amazon doesn’t have a plan to fix health care, but it loves that we’re talking about it. Facebook has a plan to fix the social network, but people may spend less time on it.

headline.print_headline: Less Time on Facebook, More Noise From Amazon
headline.main: Farhad’s Week in Tech: Less Time on Facebook, More Noise From Amazon

docs.snippet: The special counsel’s indictment detailed how crucial Facebook and Instagram were to the Russian campaign to disrupt the presidential election.

headline.print_headline: To Create Rifts, Russians Liked Facebook Most
headline.main: To Stir Discord in 2016, Russians Turned Most Often to Facebook

docs.snippet: An opposition politician argues that Hun Sen, the Asian country’s authoritarian premier, has used social media to spread fake news and strengthen his hold on power.

headline.print_headline: Scuffle Over Facebook ‘Likes’ for Cambodia’s Prime Minister Reaches a U.S. Court
headline.main: Fight Over Cambodian Leader’s Facebook ‘Likes’ Reaches a U.S. Court

docs.snippet: The social network, which is overhauling what people consume on the site, said its business would remain robust even if some users spent less time on its platform.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Chief Tries to Soothe Wall Street Over Changes to Site’s News Feed
headline.main: Facebook Aims to Soothe Wall Street Over News Feed Changes

docs.snippet: In a letter organized by the Campaign for a Commercial-Free Childhood, dozens of health experts say the new app preys on a vulnerable group.

headline.print_headline: Turn Off Messenger Kids, Health Experts Plead in a Letter to Facebook
headline.main: Turn Off Messenger Kids, Health Experts Plead to Facebook

docs.snippet: A group of Silicon Valley technologists plans to call attention to the dangers of tech, including working on an ad campaign aimed at 55,000 public schools.

headline.print_headline: Early Facebook and Google Employees Form Coalition to Fight What They Built
headline.main: Early Facebook and Google Employees Form Coalition to Fight What They Built
